description: Display target_project field on StubCard using the subtitle slot
goal: Make target_project visible on stub cards so users can see which project each stub is targeted for
requirements: Add stub.target_project to StubCard subtitle prop
Format target_project for display (e.g., 'coderef-dashboard' â†’ 'CodeRef Dashboard')
Handle missing/undefined target_project gracefully (show 'No project' or hide subtitle)
Use existing UnifiedCard subtitle prop (no component changes needed)
Maintain visual consistency with industrial theme
constraints: Do NOT modify UnifiedCard component (already has subtitle support)
Only modify StubCard component (1 line change)
Do NOT change StubCard external API

technical_context.recommended_approach: Option 1 (simple) - Just pass stub.target_project directly. Clean and minimal.

success_criteria: StubCard shows target_project as subtitle below title
Subtitle truncates if project name is too long
Missing target_project handled gracefully (no subtitle shown)
No breaking changes to StubCard API

implementation_plan.phase_1: Add subtitle={stub.target_project} to UnifiedCard props in StubCard

edge_cases: stub.target_project is undefined - UnifiedCard handles gracefully (line 64: {subtitle && ...})
stub.target_project is 'unknown' - Shows 'unknown' (user can filter these later)
Very long project name - CSS truncate handles this
Empty string target_project - Treated as falsy, no subtitle shown
